citation.article-title: Alkanibacter difficilis gen. nov., sp. nov. and Singularimonas variicoloris gen. nov., sp. nov., hexane-degrading bacteria isolated from a hexane-treated biofilter.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Alkanibacter difficilis sp. nov.
Alkanibacter difficilis (diff′i.cil.is. L. masc. adj. difficilis difficult, because it is difficult to cultivate).
Displays the following characteristics in addition to those given in the genus description.
Cells are small rods of 0.6±0.1×0.9±0.3 μm.
Colonies are transparent, yellow, circular and 1 mm in diameter on defined-medium agar with added hexane.
KOH and aminopeptidase tests give positive results and Gram-staining is negative.
Grows on hydroxybutyric acid and succinate (weakly) as carbon sources.
Optimal growth is at 30 °C; no growth occurs at 13 or 45 °C.
The type strain, MN154.3T, grows on pentane, hexane and decane.
No growth occurs in nutrient broth or on trypticase soy agar.
The major fatty acids are 16 : 0, 18 : 0, 18 : 1cis11 and 19 : 0 cyclo11–12; 14 : 0 3-OH is present.
The DNA G+C content is 62.8 mol%.
The type strain, MN154.3T (=DSM 14804T=LMG 22842T), was isolated from an industrial biofilter.
